parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
Probably akin to de; a particle of emphasis or explicitness; now, then, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
